intro: Hieraciodes sahendi, commonly known as Sahelian hieracium, is a flowering plant native to the Sahel region of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has small, narrow leaves. It produces yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieraciodes sahendi is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems.
